text.0: he hath drunk hence most marvellous and carried away our great and splendid call on indra.
text.1: the bounteous when we serve the gods accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.
text.2: the speaker filleth with a cry to indra his ears who cometh nigh een from a distance.
text.3: may this my call bring indra to my presence this call to gods composed in sacred verses.
text.4: him have i sung with my best song and praises indra of ancient birth and everlasting.
text.5: for prayer and songs in him are concentrated let laud wax mighty when addressed to indra.
text.6: indra whom sacrifice shall strengthen soma and song and hymn and praises and devotion.
text.7: whom dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth indra whom days shall strengthen months and autumns.
text.8: him born for conquering might in full perfection and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory.
text.9: great powerful will we today o singer invite to aid us and to quell our foemen.
